mdRecord.dcterms:title: Leadenhall Market, interior

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Leadenhall Market is a covered market in London; it is one of the oldest markets in London, dating back to the 14th century, and is located in the historic centre of the City of London. The main entrance to the market is on Gracechurch Street. The ornate roof structure, painted green, maroon and cream, and cobbled floors of the current structure was designed in 1881 by Sir Horace Jones. The adjacent buildings to the south have a continuous retail frontage which is punctuated by narrow entrances to pedestrian ways into the market. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leadenhall_Market [work]
